critique: The document is an executive order regarding silver purchase. As the President, I want to convey a sense of confidence and control, but also fairness and a focus on the public good. The order is presented as a necessary step to effectuate the policy of the Silver Purchase Act of 1934. There's an element of surprise in the requirement for delivery of silver, but also reassurance through exceptions and reimbursement of costs. There is no anger, disgust, fear, or sadness intended to be conveyed. The primary emotions are joy and surprise. The tone is authoritative and decisive, aiming to instill confidence.
